channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry Awarded to Architects of Metal-Organic Frameworks
item.description: The prize was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi for the development of a new type of molecular architecture.

item.title: Myanmar Military Paraglider Bombs Buddhist Festival, Killing Dozens
item.description: The junta targeted a festival in the Sagaing region where people were also protesting army rule, according to witnesses and the civilian government in...

item.title: How ‘Les Mis’ Became So Successful
item.description: We look at the story behind its more than 15,000-show run.

item.title: Jamie Dimon isn’t taking a recession off the table for 2026: ‘You don’t wish it because certain people will get hurt’
item.description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says a U.S. recession could hit in 2026, a warning to markets not to get complacent despite strong GDP growth and AI optimism

item.title: Comey Goes to Court, and Gold Prices Hit Record High
item.description: Plus, how job applicants are tricking A.I.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Steve Eisman warns the U.S. economy is a ‘tale of two cities’ that ‘is not even growing 50 basis points outside of AI’
item.description: Eisman said if you erase AI infrastructure spending from projected U.S. GDP growth for 2025, the economic picture exposes a struggling consumer.

item.title: OpenAI dreams of Apple
item.description: OpenAI’s DevDay, held Monday at San Francisco’s historic Fort Mason, was exceptionally Apple-coded.

item.title: Multimillionaire serial entrepreneur cried the first time she made ‘real money’—but not in a good way: ‘Wealth doesn’t erase your problems. It magnifies them’
item.description: Emily Lyons said commas in her bank account didn’t help her feel relieved, but rather scared of losing all she had gained.

item.title: Gold’s price record is driven by the ‘debasement trade,’ China, and fear of an AI bubble, analysts say
item.description: Gold surged over $4,000/oz, up 50% this year, driven by investor fears over government debt, a weaker dollar, a buying spree by China’s central bank, ...

item.title: In Syria, a Crackdown on Gunfire at Weddings
item.description: Marriages and other glad occasions in Syria are often celebrated by firing shots in the air. But after nearly 14 years of war, people want the guns to...

item.title: Napa on the Aegean: A Turkish Wine Region Re-emerges
item.description: Urla, a lush district in western Turkey, is bursting with promise, with easy access to beaches, an up-and-coming gastronomy scene and a well-marked vi...

item.title: How the Right Uses Charlie Kirk’s Death to Further Their Policies
item.description: The mayor of Lima, Peru, held a Charlie Kirk memorial — filled with attendees bused in from poor neighborhoods — as he sought help from the Trump admi...

item.title: Meet ‘Porky,’ Lima’s Right-Wing Mayor Embracing Trump’s MAGA Movement
item.description: By embodying President Trump’s brash style, Rafael López Aliaga has become a leading candidate to be Peru’s next president.
